Dialogue: Forget it.  The boys on the board want that shuttle to go on schedule.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: And what do the boys on the board know about safety, Commissioner?  Let me talk to them.

Dialogue: And I'll be the one they'll hang if there's a screw-up.

Dialogue: Listen, Bud, the boys downtown are under heavy fire from the boys in Washington. That's why they're putting pressure on the boys on the board.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Commissioner.

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: I just wish it was that simple.

Speaker: controller
Dialogue: This is Mercury One control.  We have condition green.  Mark launch 'T' minus two hours and counting.  I repeat, we have condition green.

Dialogue: This condition isn't as bad as it could be if it were a lot worse.  Take these pills.  Here's some water.

Speaker: controller
Dialogue: What is it, doctor?

Dialogue: Here.

Speaker: simon

Dialogue: Simon.

Dialogue: Who would believe that Elaine Thompson was once a stewardess on the Denver-Chicago run.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: And I can hardly believe that I'm engaged to someone like you, Simon.  I'm a very lucky woman.

Speaker: simon

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: And that's an order, Lieutenant.

Speaker: sarg
Dialogue: Is there someone else, Marge?  Is that it?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Sarg, there's been someone else for fifteen years.  You were just too involved in your work to see it.

Dialogue: Don't wait up for me, sweetheart.  We're testing the retro-rockets tonight.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: What's his problem?

I want an M.O. on everyone who has seen THE SOUND OF MUSIC and I want the entire population of Hawaii off that rock and into the water within one hour.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Repeat analysis.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: Negative.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: That's not possible.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: Cut the Doubting Thomas shit, Elaine.  I know where I'm coming from on this.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I guess this is pretty exciting for you.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Yes, it is.  How long will the trip take?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Our actual flight time is over fourteen months, but due to the time-space variant at sub-light speeds, our onboard flight time will be just over eighteen hours.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Gee, Mom, how does that work?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: How many times do I have to tell you, I'm not your mother!  I've never seen you before!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Hallucinating again, Rhonda?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I don't know what it is.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Maybe it's the brand of glue you've been sniffing.  Why don't you try this, NO-HI. It gives you all the pleasure of glue without the brain damage.

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: Something to read, sir?

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Do you have PSYCHO MONTH?

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: I think so.  Here you are.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Would you like something to read?

Speaker: texan
Dialogue: I don't read a whole lot, but what have you got, hon?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: TIME, NEWSWEEK, BUSINESS WEEK, and the TALMUD...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: The twenty-four volume dissertation on the Hebrew law.

Speaker: texan
Dialogue: Let me try that Talmud.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: And you, sir?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Oh... Popular Electronics.

Speaker: psychiatrist
Dialogue: You must admit that you're sick, Ted.  Sick Ted, sick Ted...

Speaker: texan
Dialogue: Wanta switch when we're finished?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Here.  I need some oxygen.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Have you got it straightened out now?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I think so.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: That's my girl.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: Elaine, I'm sorry about that little outburst a moment ago.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: That's okay, ROK.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: Can I say something of a personal nature to you?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: You have great tits.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon, I'm going to check ROK's secondary readout unit.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Roger.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Yes, Mary?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Would you like a little breakfast, Captain Oveur?  Over.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: A couple eggs and juice would be nice, Mary.  Over.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: No.  Poached.  Over.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Just poached on toast.  Over.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I don't think we do poached eggs on toast over, Captain Oveur.  Over.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: That's how I want them.  Poached.  Over.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: All right, Captain Oveur.  Over.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Poached!  Not over!  Over!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: You should really put that case in the compartment above your head, sir.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: That's okay.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I can help you if you can't get it up.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: I said, no!

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: I sure an glad they let Scraps ride up here with us.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I bet Scraps is going to love Mercury.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Do you think things will be a lot different on Mercury, Dad?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's going to be terrific.  A whole new world, new kids to play with.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: You're going to love it, Jimmy.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: No more headlines about the rape trial and the fraud charges?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: How many kids get a chance to live on another planet.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: No more kids yelling, 'Your old man's a thieving rapist'?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Look, a man can make an honest mistake!! Anyway, she was asking for it!  They're all asking for it all the time!!

Speaker: psychiatrist
Dialogue: You must admit that you're sick, Ted... sick, Ted... sick, Ted...

Speaker: dunn
Dialogue: We seem to have a malfunction in disposal unit four, sir.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: You better check it, Unger.

Speaker: uger
Dialogue: Done.

Speaker: dunn
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted.  I don't know why you got on this flight.  I don't know what you're trying to prove.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine, we have to go back.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: We can't go back.  We had something very special, but it's all over.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine, I mean the mission has to be aborted.  This ship should never have passed FSA inspection.  This thing is held together by string and chewing gum.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, get a grip on yourself.  You should never have left the hospital.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Then you do think I'm insane.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I've never used the word insane, Ted.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: What word would you use, Elaine?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: The word is sick.  Ted -- very, very, very sick.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: What would you say if I told you the toilet just blew up in my face.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I'd use the word insane.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: There's something dangerously wrong with this ship, Elaine.  I know its the wiring. That toilet's just the tip of the iceberg.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, a toilet's not going to kill anyone.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: You've been hurt.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I'm getting over it.  If a relationship isn't working, you can't force it.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: No, I mean your head.  Sit down.  I'll take a look at it.  I'm a nurse.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Do you want to talk about it.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I opened this panel and a vacuum cleaner hit me.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: No.  I mean your relationship.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: We were in love but I'm not sure I know what love is anymore.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Love's the same as it always was.  It's people who change.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: People change in relation to each other. Love changes on its own.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Not if the people change together in relation to that love.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Sure.  But that's only when the love itself goes unchanged.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Then the relationship remains the same and the love changes only when there's change in the two people who share that love.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I just wish it was that simple.  We really were in love.  You know how it is when you laugh all the time.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: No.  It's hard to L-A-U-G-H when your father's dying.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Well, we laughed.  We laughed all the time.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: That's our story.

Speaker: dunn
Dialogue: Sir, I've got an overload in disposal unit four.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: You better check on it, Mr. Dunn.  I'll stay here and fly the ship.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Dunn.

Speaker: dunn
Dialogue: Sir?

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: You better take this.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Mind if Jimmy here takes a look around, Captain?

Speaker: ovuer
Dialogue: Of course not.  Come on in, Jimmy.  That's strange.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Now what?

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: That's an asteroid field.  There shouldn't be anything like that in this sector unless...

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Unless?

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Unless those sunspots are interfering with our scanner or...

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Or?

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Or we're off course, but...

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: But?

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: But we couldn't be off course.  Our coordinates are computer-locked barring...

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Barring?

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Barring a computer failure.  There was talk of sub-par wiring in this ship.  I hope that's just talk.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Come on up, Jimmy.  Say, that's some puppy.  What's his name?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Scraps.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Can I hold him?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: He's a boy dog.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Do you like it when Scraps sleeps on his back, Jimmy?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: They kept me in the asylum for eight months.  I know everyone in those places claims they're sane, but I was different, I was sane.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Holy shit.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Ted, I want you to relax.  Let your mind go back, back past your youth, past your childhood to your mother's womb.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Try to remember your birth.  Was it difficult?

Speaker: doctor's voice
Dialogue: Striker, listen to me!  This is Doctor Krane!  You're twisted around, Striker. You've got to come out feet first!  You're too low in the womb!  You're too low, Striker!  You're...  ... too low...

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Ted, are you okay?  Here, take one of these stress pills.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Request; comprehensive electrical systems check.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: Systems check positive.  Look, Elaine, I...

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Request; life support systems check.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: Life support check.  Elaine, it's obvious you've been ignoring me.  You're a woman. I can relate to that.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Request; self-analysis of ROK hardware and software systems regarding behavioral changes.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: There's nothing wrong with me, Elaine. What about tonight -- just you and me.  We can be alone.  I can get rid of everyone else on the ship -- I've already proven that.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Do you want to talk about it, Commander?

Speaker: dunn
Dialogue: Did you feel that?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Yes I did...

Speaker: dunn
Dialogue: Felt like a large asteroid.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Yes it did.  Mr. Dunn, can I ask you a personal question?

Speaker: dunn
Dialogue: What is it, Mary?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Um...  Do you people scream right when you... you know.

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: Hand me your cup.  This is very hot.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Thank you.  And, stewardess, can you please tell my wife that there is nothing that can go wrong.  I think she'd like to hear it from you.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I don't think we have any alternative, Captain.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: I see.  What do you think our alternatives are?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: We have to disconnect ROK's higher brain functions without disturbing his regulatory system.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Roger.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: You can do it from up here, Captain.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: I'd rather sit down for this one, Elaine.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: No, I mean you can do it from the cockpit.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Roger.  You better get back there and monitor the regulatory unit.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Captain, the coffee machine is jammed and I don't like it.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Have you tried it with a little cinnamon?

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: Captain Oveur, Dunn and Unger have been sucked out through disposal unit four!

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Both together?!

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: All right, calm down.  Here's how we're going to play it.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Mary, I want you here.  Testa, you move across here past Dawkins' pick and get the ball at the top of the key from Irving.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: What are you doing, Captain?

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: I wouldn't do that, Captain.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Sox... zip...

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: We're off course, heading right through that asteroid field and right at the... at the sun!

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: McCrosky?  He hasn't handled a tower in twenty years.

Speaker: controller 4
Dialogue: Ever since Reagan fired the controllers, he's been completely senile and hasn't done a day's work.

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: Pretty much the same as Reagan.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: It's for Mr. McCrosky.

Speaker: nurse 2
Dialogue: Do you think we should bother him?  He's been acting a bit odd lately.

Speaker: nurse 1
Dialogue: He's fine.  He just thinks he's Lloyd Bridges.

Speaker: nurse 1
Dialogue: The phone's for you, Mr. McCrosky.

Speaker: nurse 1
Dialogue: Here, let me help you.  I think it's the space centre.  Now, let's not get too excited.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon!  Captain Oveur!

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Mets... nine... Phils... three... Cubs... four...

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon, what's happening?!

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: He tried to disconnect ROK.  It gassed him.  That computer is running this ship and we're heading right for the sun.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Can't we change course?

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: We're computer locked and the manual navigation unit is down.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Then Ted was right!

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: My career is shot.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Your career!  What about the lives of those people out there.  Simon, what happened to the man I thought I loved?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I've got to get Ted.  Just don't come apart on me now, Simon.

Speaker: terrorist 1
Dialogue: This is flight to Miami, yes?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Please, ladies and gentlemen, please calm down.  Listen to me!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: We've been thrown off course just a tad.

Speaker: passenger
Dialogue: What's that mean?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: In space terms, about 70 million miles.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: The bumps you feel are car-sized asteroids smashing into the hull.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Also, we're heading right for the sun and can't seem to change course.

Speaker: passenger
Dialogue: Are you telling us everything?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Not exactly.  We're also out of coffee.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: I've always loved you, darling.  I was unfaithful just once.  Remember Jill, my first secretary?  Forgive me.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: That's all behind us now.

Speaker: passenger
Dialogue: We're going to crash!!

Speaker: terrorist 1
Dialogue: God is great!!

Speaker: terrorist 2
Dialogue: Death to America!!

Speaker: terrorist 3
Dialogue: The yellow pencil is on the table of my aunt!!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: There is absolutely nothing to worry about!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Your crew is in complete control of the situation.

Speaker: controller 1
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: controller 1
Dialogue: Yes, sir! Welcome home, sir!

Speaker: controller 2
Dialogue: Here are the navigational charts, sir.

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: controller 4
Dialogue: Here's all the available information on the sun.  That thing's hot, sir.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: First the earth cooled.  Then the dinosaurs came but were too big and died and everything got rotten and turned into oil and the Arabs bought Mercedes Benzs and then there was the best TV special on Judy Garland.  Then we lost the war with Albania.  Then...

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, Ted.  Listen to me, Ted.  You were right all along.  Ted, we've lost the crew and Simon's turned to jelly!

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Do you want to talk about it now, Commander?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: My God.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: He's finally come to terms with his own psychosis.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: But he was right!  He's not crazy!

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Miss, I'm a nurse with a dying F-A-T-H-E- R, I know what I'm talking about.  Now I'm going to need fresh sheets, gauze, Q-tips, and all the vaseline you have on board! Now!

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: I'll need all the boiling water you can get your hands on!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Are you a nurse?

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Yes.  The washroom's down there on your right.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: And not too much!

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Can I help?

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Keep an eye on that side of the ship.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: I'll need all your boiling water.

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: We should be out of this momentarily. There's nothing to worry about.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Thank you.  That makes me feel so much better.

Speaker: guard one
Dialogue: Damn!  I want that patient shot on sight!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Maybe you gotta be crazy to end up behind the eight ball like this.  Anyway, you find out pretty fast who your friends are when you're on the lamb.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I'm going out for cigarettes and a fifth of bourbon.  Don't wait up for me.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Virgin wool.  Nothin' but headaches.

Speaker: professor 1
Dialogue: And I say essence precedes existence.

Speaker: professor 2
Dialogue: You're crazy!  Existence precedes essence.

Speaker: professor 1
Dialogue: Essence!

Speaker: professor 2
Dialogue: Existence!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: The last thing I wanted was Elaine to see me down on my luck.  Well, it was just my luck.  In she walked with a group from the space program.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I don't know who you are or how you lost your sight, but I'll never forget this night as long as I live.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Striker.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Kurtz, you're drunk.  Who's in command of this ship?

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: That damn computer has taken over.  I'm getting out.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Then Elaine was right.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Don't talk to me about Elaine.  Outta my way!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Pull yourself together!  We've got to...

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Father, what should I do?

Speaker: controller 1
Dialogue: Let me try, sir.  Come in, Mayflower. Over.  Come in.  Over.  Damnit!

Speaker: controller 2
Dialogue: Let me try, sir.  Come in.  Over.  Damnit!

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: Let me try, sir.

Speaker: controller 5
Dialogue: Give 'em the lead!

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: I'm afraid that leg's going to have to come off.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: Wait.  This isn't your chart.  You just had a touch of air sickness.  You'll be fine.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I'm terrified.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: And I'm a nurse.  Everything will be okay. Pass it on.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Are you feeling okay, mister?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I'm feeling just fine, son.  Just fine.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon, I...

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Hello.  This is the Mayflower.  Over! Come in, anyone.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: This is Elaine Thompson.  I'm five-six, 123 pounds with brown hair and I'm sitting down and facing the front.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: Maybe she's got her shit together.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine, what's going on?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, there's no time to explain.

Speaker: oveur
Dialogue: Packers... seven... Vikings... three...

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, I was wrong about you.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: We all make mistakes, Elaine.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: How could I ever have doubted you?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: That's all behind us now, Elaine.  And no matter what happens, I want you to know I've always loved you.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I love you, Ted.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, this reminds me of twenty years ago over Chicago.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: This is Mayflower One calling mission control.  Do you read me?  Over.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: The name's Ted Striker and I'm sitting down and facing the front.

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: If you say so.

Speaker: controller 1
Dialogue: Could be those sunspots.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: Could be your dishwashing detergent.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: Me!  Me!  Me!

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: The boys downtown are taking the heat from the boys in Washington and the boys...

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: Bud, the President wants an explanation.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Forget it.  I was reading.

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: I was reading too.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: What's the story?

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: Some southern plantation owner falls in love with this poor...

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: I was asking McCrosky, Commissioner.

Speaker: controller
Dialogue: Sir, we've restored radio transmission.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Give it to me straight, McCrosky -- what's it look like.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Not the radio, the situation.  I want to know exactly what your people think.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: General Walker is here, Billy.  He wants to talk to you.

Speaker: general walker
Dialogue: Billy, if we get through this thing alive, I'd like you to get this letter to my mother.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: An electrical fire in the core has played havoc with the ROK-4000 computer.  It's locked us on a direct line with the sun and there's no way we can go to manual. Captain Oveur already tried it and he's...

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: ... become an intolerable bore.  The rest of the crew has been lost and we're out of coffee.  Also, we're starting to feel the sun's heat pretty bad.

Speaker: man one
Dialogue: It's eight-thousand square feet with great parking and a twenty-year lease with option to buy.

Speaker: man two
Dialogue: You can't lose, Al.

Speaker: man three
Dialogue: He can lose.  I've seen it happen a thousand times.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: I wish I could talk like that -- so macho yet so sensitive.

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: The cabin temperature is rising.  The passengers want to know what's happening up here.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Let us handle this end of things.  Now what's the coffee situation?

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: It just won't drip!  I've tried everything.  And the passengers are dropping like flies from the heat.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine, I'm going back there.  Just hold onto that stick and try to control this hunk of tin as best you can.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, please be careful.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: It doesn't look good.  The drip seems to be jammed up pretty bad.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: To tell you the truth, sir, I don't really know.

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: Eighty-three.  What's that mean?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Mr. McCrosky, Mr. Coffee.  Coffee, McCrosky.

Speaker: london times
Dialogue: "DEEP SPACE DEATH CERTAIN"

Speaker: jerusalem post
Dialogue: "THEY SHOULDN'T HAVE GONE IN THE FIRST PLACE"

Speaker: anchor 1
Dialogue: Four alarm fire rages through downtown Buffalo!

Speaker: anchor 2
Dialogue: Mercury shuttle heads for sun.

Speaker: anchor 1
Dialogue: Four alarm fire guts Tokyo apartment.

Speaker: anchor 2
Dialogue: Mercury mission in death struggle.

Speaker: anchor 1
Dialogue: Four alarm fire in downtown Moscow clears way for glorious new tractor factory.

Speaker: anchor 2
Dialogue: Capitalist, imperialist adventurism ends in space disaster.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: If this country was run by vegetarian women who's old men deserted them after knocking them up instead of by meat-eating males, this thing never would have happened.

Speaker: enquirer
Dialogue: I never forget a face.  'Texas doctor claims sex with chicken cures baldness?'

Speaker: star
Dialogue: 'Severed legs grow back after Utah man finds Christ?'

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Check.

Speaker: passenger
Dialogue: Is this a coffee bean?

Speaker: all passengers
Dialogue: He's got a bean!!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: It looks like the solder point has melted.

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: Who's in charge here, Mister?

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: Hallick, homicide.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: Jacobs, Pisces.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Kruger, Sagittarius.

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: Commissioner, Aquarius.

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: We have information that one of your passengers is carrying a bomb and might be suicidal.

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: We have our methods.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: And what methods are those?

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: Have you heard of the Heimlich method?

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: Exactly.

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: Good.  This is the passenger's wife.  Mrs. Joe Salucci.

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: The way I read it, blowin' up a plane in space leaves no traces, if you know what I mean.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: I'm not exactly sure what you mean, Captain.

Speaker: detective hallick
Dialogue: No blood.  No body.  No bones.  No eyes. No ears.  No throats.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: He's impotent.

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: He's suicidal.

Speaker: all
Dialogue: And he's stupid!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Contact.

Speaker: controller 2
Dialogue: Here are the tests we ran on their computer.  I had them xeroxed for you.

Speaker: controller 2
Dialogue: Upside-down, but I turned each page over and put them in order.  I'm afraid that computer is totally capable of taking control of that ship.

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: These are their position calculations. They've got about ten minutes before they start to burn up.

Speaker: controller 4
Dialogue: Sir, your headlights are on and your doors are locked!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, we've only got ten minutes.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Not now, Elaine.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I mean until we start to burn up.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: We're closer to the sun than I estimated.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: This is Striker.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Look, Striker, I don't know how you got into that driver's seat but I want Simon Kurtz on that radio and I want him now!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Kurtz was the one who got us into this mess in the first place.  You people knew this ship wasn't ready to fly.  You played God with over a hundred lives, Kruger, and for what -- the prestige of your precious space program.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: That was very well put, Ted.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Striker, you're heading right for the sun, so don't you think it's a little late for that bleeding heart liberal crap now?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: He's got a point, Ted.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Call me a bleeding heart, but if we get through this thing I'm preparing a paper on alternative spending directives recommending the transfer of space program funds to low cost housing.

Speaker: kruger
Dialogue: Just put Kurtz on that radio!!

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: Someone's car wouldn't start.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: I'll get the cards and bridge mix.

Speaker: sarg
Dialogue: That's my little girl, my little darlin', my sweetheart, my honey, and you want to blow her belly out with that bomb.  If you blast here in the computer core and the fuselage doesn't give way here and the main communication lines to the cockpit hold here and this baby here doesn't jam this little old unit up here and throw about two tons of hot steel through here like a hot knife through butter and the upper and lower...

Speaker: sarg
Dialogue: I have no point.

Speaker: controllers
Dialogue: No sir.

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: Should a man in his forties have a circumcision?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Well, Elaine, this might be it if those guys on the ground don't think of something.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: I just want you to know, I love you Ted and always will.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: That might be the news we've been waiting for.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Roger.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: A b...

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Which passenger is Joe Salucci?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Sixteen 'C', why?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: He's carrying a bomb.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: A b...

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: No, a bomb.  Now, as discreetly as possible, I want you to move the passengers into the lounge.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: What should I say?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Anything.  Just don't let Salucci think we're onto him.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Would everyone not carrying a bomb please move to the lounge.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Don't anyone move!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Mr. Salucci, listen to me.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Joe, you don't want to blow that thing and kill all these innocent people.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: I don't want to live anymore.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Joe, the insurance policy won't help your wife and kids.  You bought auto insurance, not life insurance.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: That's right, Joe.  Now, no one's going to hurt you and no one has to know what's wrong with you.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: You're sure?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I'm sure.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: That's the guy from the terminal who can't get it up!!

Speaker: all controllers
Dialogue: He's got the bomb!!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: This is just like an election in Iran.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: This heat's getting unbearable.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: But it is a dry heat, Ted.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I know what you're going to say, McCrosky -- knock out the wall between the cockpit and cabin and hang plants.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: The b...

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Why, you'd have to be crazy to try a stunt like that.

Speaker: doctor's voice
Dialogue: You're too low in the womb, Striker! You've got to come out feet first!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine.  I'm going back there.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted... I love you.  Be careful.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: How about a show just like Hollywood Squares but with kids.  Gary Coleman could host.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Now I want everyone to move to the front of the cabin.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: That's fine.  Stay calm.  We just want everyone as far away from the blast as possible.

Speaker: rok
Dialogue: What are you doing, Ted?  Why are you wearing that mask, Ted?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon!  Wait!  What are you doing?!

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: I've lost the ship and now I've lost you, Elaine.  I'm getting out.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon, I didn't want it to end like this. We can be friends!  You'll die out there.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: Maybe.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon, what are you saying?!

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: I'm saying, I can't take the singles scene again, Elaine.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon, no!

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: You want to talk about it now, Commander?

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: Give me the President of the United States.  Tell him it's the Commissioner.  I don't know how the old man's going to take this.

Speaker: aid
Dialogue: Houston, sir.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: This is the President... What?!... What?!

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: I don't think that shuttle's going to make it, sir.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Damnit, Mister, the dignity and integrity of this presidency depends on the success of that mission.  And that's my last word!

Speaker: commissioner
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: aid
Dialogue: What's our strategy on this one, sir?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I work for the people of these United States, Frank.  I have to do what's best for them.  Al, kill social security, cancel school lunches only for the poor, dismantle welfare, close all hospitals and public toilets, green light the MX-6, invade Brazil, and bring my horse around after my nap!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Simon just ejected!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Sit down, Elaine.  If this bomb trick works we just might make it.  Simon was a fool to eject now.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: You mean...

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: That's right -- premature ejection.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: What will happen to him, Ted?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: The sun will heat that thing to over 450 degrees within seconds.  He'll roast like a pig on a spit.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Are you afraid?

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Not when I'm with you, Ted.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I guess you'd have to be a fool not to be afraid at a time like this.

Speaker: stella
Dialogue: I'm a nurse.  I can't afford to be afraid, Father.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Are you afraid, Scraps?

Speaker: scraps
Dialogue: Now how about a little scratch on the inner thigh?

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: Fifty-six percent of the passengers are afraid.  Twenty-nine percent are not afraid.  Eight percent are undecided and seven percent think Israel should give back Finland.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: You better strap yourself in, Testa.  Mission control, this is Mayflower.  Over.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: We've got about 60 seconds before that thing blows.  We're set to reprogram for Mercury at zero point five WORP.

Speaker: jacobs
Dialogue: Last spring we did Europe in nine days.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Heads between the knees!  Between your own knees, Father!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Elaine!  Set course change!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Set!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Compute!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Here goes.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Point five WORP!

Speaker: stinson
Dialogue: Al Hammil?

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: Not anymore.  It's Rex Kramer, now.

Speaker: controller 3
Dialogue: No, Rex Kramer.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: I know this guy, Ted Striker.  I flew with him during the war.  He was a crack pilot but he didn't have it in the crunch... That is...

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Until that day over Chicago.  He brought that busted up 767 out of that storm like a paper glider coming outta the baby blue.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: But flying that shuttle is a whole different ballgame.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: What's the latest, Lieutenant?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: They'll hit our atmosphere in about three minutes, if they hold together.  They've lost their computer and are coming in at zero point five WORP on manual control, sir.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Down scope!

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: He'll never bring that thing in on manual, but I guess Striker's their only hope.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: It's his ship now.  He's the top dog.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: The big man.  The numero uno honcho.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: The head cheese.

Speaker: officer 2
Dialogue: Sir, we have radio contact.

Speaker: testa
Dialogue: We're travelling at one half the speed of light.  There is nothing to worry about. However, you might experience some temporary metabolic changes.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, the lever!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Kramer, the WORP control handle just came off in my hand.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: There are no more handles, only switches.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Just switches, lights, and knobs.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Okay, Striker.  You're going to have to pull that lever panel off.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Screw driver!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Will this work, Ted?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Thanks.  I've got something that might work.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: What the hell is a man doing with a... forget it.  It'll have to do, Striker.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: It's working.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Okay, Striker.  We have you on visual. Just keep her level.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: She's coming apart!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I'm trying but she's fighting me!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, that's Alpha Beta!

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Now, Striker, there are a few things you have to keep in mind as you get close to the planet's atmosphere.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: First and foremost you have to make one very important decision.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted!  We're not stopping!!

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Now, once you've made that decision you have to be very clear about your responsibility to those people on that ship.

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted!

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Seat backs up.  Thank you.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Sir, you really must take your seat.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: We're all with you on this one, Striker. Now get ready to position landing gear, cut engines, and fire your retrorockets.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Timing's of the essence on a lame duck approach, Striker.  Don't fight her.  Hold her steady.  Nose up.

Speaker: kramer
Dialogue: Timing's everything, Striker!  Fire your retro-rockets!

Speaker: elaine
Dialogue: Ted, what's going to happen to us?

Speaker: crawl
Dialogue: FAR, FAR AWAY IN THE DEEPEST REGIONS OF OUR VAST SOLAR SYSTEM, A SMALL, BRAVE GROUP OF PIONEERS EMBARK ON A BOLD NEW ADVENTURE.  THEIR MISSION:  TO OPEN UP A NEW FRONTIER.  THEIR GOAL, TO BUILD A BRAVE NEW WORLD.

Speaker: creature
Dialogue: Hello, we'd like you to have this flower. We're with the Church of Mercurial Consciousness.  Would you like to make a donation?
